title: Done with League of Legends
body: Its been a fun ride everyone, ever since season 3 loved the game and the competitive scene played many games and with friends had the best time. But i really do not see myself getting any higher than gold and Ive been stuck there for 2 years, i did put a lot of time and effort into learning every champ and abilities and focused on almost every aspect of the game and tune into a few a few channels that teach me how to play league better. But more often than not I find myself with others who do not understand that just csing and not being killed until out of laining phase is a good thing I can carry myself in lane but I dont know how you guys at riot expect me to carry more than 1 other person that is my support or just myself when im mid, i mostly play ranked alone because its my preferred game style so dynamic que does not help id rather wait 20 mins for a game that has an equal teams on each side than a 3 min loss of 20 lp because of uneven matchmaking, I ward, focus on turrets not kills ping for drags and all that but its pointless when people dont understand those key elements. I will miss you guys at riot for making jinx she will forever be my favorite champ but i guess ive reached my highest potential in League.

Incorrect.

Normal 5v5's 3v3's, Aram's and the rotational game modes are for "fun". The casual gamer.

Ranked games are a place to test your steel against others. A place where you find out where you sit upon the throne that is league of legends.

If you are going into ranked games with the "lets have fun" attitude, you are part of the problem.

This is a game.
People who take it way too seriously _are_ the problem.

Shitty riven/yasuo players that have a "carry or feed" mentality and either int or afk if they are not 5/0 by 15 minutes. People that flame their team for not being perfect. Typically they also flame their team every time they make a mistake, to try and cover up the mistake (nobody is fooled).
Kids that come and shitpost on the forums if they loose to anything they dislike, because they cant just accept it is a game with no rewards, and unable to understand that it does not matter if they win or loose.

I think people have it backwards, and think how good they are is determined by their rank, instead of the reverse (and in this season, barely related).

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=TEwwrEAE,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-04T03:08:24.423+0000)
>
>People that flame their team for not being perfect. 

I actually made a post about this, not too long ago. In ranked, I can understand the desire to have the perfect team, but you can't expect EVERY player to play on the same playing field. (Hence rank) People have varying playstyles, varying item builds, varying champion pools, varying preferred roles. There are so many different types of players in this game, that there's absolutely no way to be "perfect" at it. Besides, if everyone was "perfect", then what'd be the point.

But, ignoring all of this, people need to stop flaming people in normal games. They need to stop with the incessant "mia" pings. They need to stop with the "dude, you're so trash" commentary. They need to start giving actual advice, like, "Hey, your opponent is taking advantage of you being out of position. Try to do 'x' and 'y' and see if that works." or "Hey, your opponent is taking advantage of you not having 'mag res'. I know you want to rush damage, but trust me, building 'z' [Mag Res/Damage item] may help you."

If your complaint is that people are losing your ranked games, help them NOT lose them. HELP THEM HELP YOU.

>Typically they also flame their team every time they make a mistake, to try and cover up the mistake (nobody is fooled).

Players like this would go in to a 2v1 that they, by no possible means, would win, and then blame their teammates for not following up. Sure, maybe if they did follow up, you maybe [just maybe] could have gotten a kill or two, but what if they didn't think the kill(s) was worth it? What if they were busy taking a tower nearby (you know, those things that win us the game if we take enough of them)? What if they were behind and they weren't trying to take any unnecessary risks? What if they were oom or low on HP at the time, did you look to see?

It's just so ridiculous how hard people try to cover up their own mistakes, by use of flaming their teammates. Flaming your team doesn't erase the fact that you messed up, right then. You made that mistake, not your team. Just accept it and know how to not repeat the mistake in the future. Your team is there to help you. If you don't like having to rely on other players, you shouldn't be playing a team-based game. Go play single player ones and let us enjoy the team environment.

Low Diamond animal here:

1) Getting higher in rank is about playing exclusively 2-3 champions, not every champion. 
2) It is not always preferable to just CS in lane, it highly depends on the champions and what is happening on the map.
3) Often you have to focus on kills and catching people out or forcing battles on objectives before focusing turrets.
You shouldn't quit yet, try out Season 7. Maybe this season you'll get to Diamond, may as well try your luck!
